description: DEMOLITION OF DOUBLE GARAGE IN THE REAR GARDEN AND ERECTION OF GARDEN STUDIO WITH EXTERNAL LIGHT WELL AND DIRECT ACCESS TO BASEMENT FROM THE GARDEN.(PROPOSALS INVOLVE A WIDENING OF EXTERNAL ENTRANCE STAIRS FROM THOSE PREVIOUSLY APPROVED)
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:Site location plan, drawings (07)-001 H, (08)-001 E & (09)-001 E
Condition : 3 - No external lighting shall be installed without the prior approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 4 - The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied at any time other than for purposes incidental to the residential use of the dwelling known as 94 Aylward Road.

Condition : 5 - No demolition or construction work or ancillary activities such as deliveries shall take place before 8am or after 6pm Mondays - Fridays inclusive, before 8am or after 1pm on Saturdays or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 6 - Notwithstanding the details for a replacement tree previously approved and shown on drawing (07)-001 H, details of a replacement tree shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and shall be planted by the conclusion of site works and prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, whichever is the sooner. The tree shall be maintained, with replacements if necessary, to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 7 - The works shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved under application 18/P3770 for the discharge of conditions 3 Materials, 7 Construction vehicles and 9 Construction method statement. Reason to ensure a satisfactory appearance for the development and to allow construction to take place without having a negative impact on neighbours or the operation of the highway in accordance with Merton's Sites and Policy Plan 2014 policy DM D2 and Policy CS 20 of the Merton Core strategy 2011.

Condition : 8 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   ii) The application was approved without delay.
